context: The Estonian verb 'armastada' means to love or have affection for someone or something. It is a first-conjugation verb and follows regular conjugation patterns in present tense: armastan (I love), armastad (you love), armastab (he/she/it loves), armastame (we love), armastate (you [plural] love), armastavad (they love). This word expresses deep affection, romantic love, or strong liking for people, animals, things, activities, etc.
